paper_title.en: Template synthesis of copper complexes of dinucleating and tetranucleating macrocyclic ligands

description.en: The reaction of N,N'-dimethyl-N,N'-trimethylenedi(3-aminomethyl-5-methylsalicylaldehydato)copper(II) with 1,3-diaminopropane in DMF afforded the [1 + 1] condensation product [Cu(L)] and the [2 + 2] condensation product [Cu-2(R)]. The dinucleating macrocyclic ligand (L)(2-) has one N(amine)(2)O-2 and one N(imine)(2)O-2 metal-binding sites sharing two phenolic oxygen atoms and the tetranucleating macrocyclic ligand (R)(4-) has two N(amine)202 and two N(imine)(2)O-2 sites in an alternate arrangement in the macrocyclic framework. The mixture of [Cu(L)] and [Cu-2(R)] was treated with CuCl2 to give [Cu-2(L)Cl-2] (1a) and [Cu-4(R)Cl-4] (2a), which were separated based on different solubility in methanol. 1a and 2a were converted into [Cu-2(L)](ClO4)(2) (1b) and [Cu-4(R)(dmf)(2)](ClO4)(4).2H(2)O (2b), respectively, by the treatment with AgClO4. 1a and 1b each has a dinuclear core doubly bridged by the phenolic oxygen atoms. The crystal structure of [Cu-4(R)(dmf)(2)](ClO4)(4).2DMF.H2O.PrOH (PrOH = 2-propanol) (2b') was determined by X-ray crystallography. It has a dimer-of-dimers structure where each N(amine)(2)O-2 entity accommodates one Cu ion in the usual tetradentate chelating mode, whereas each N(imine)(2)O-2 entity assumes a spread shape to combine one Cu ion with its NO donor atoms and another Cu ion with the remaining NO donor atoms. 2b can be converted into 2a in the presence of chloride ion. Based on magnetic and visible spectral studies, 2a is supposed to have a folded structure of 2b with two Cu-Cl-Cu linkages.

publication_name.en: BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

Synthesis, characterization, and activation of thermally stable mu-1,2-peroxodiiron(III) complex

description.en: A thermally stable (mu -acetato)(mu -oxo)(mu -1,2-peroxo)-diiron(III) complex [Fe-2(O-2)(O)(OAc)(L)](CF3SO3) {L: 1,2-bis [2-(bis(2-pyridyl)methyl)-6-pyridyl] ethane} has been isolated, characterized, and activated. [Fe-2-O(O-2)(O)(OAc)(L)](CF3SO3) in MeCN is thermally stable; the half-life time tau (1/2) = 7.7 h at 300 K. [Fe-2-(O-2)(O)(OAc)(L)](CF3SO3) is activated upon addition of RCOCl (R = m-ClC6H4, CH3, and CCl3) in the presence of DMF to oxygenate cyclohexane and cyclohexene to the corresponding alcohols and ketones.
